data_stream module

class data_stream.DataStream

Bases: abc.ABC

abstract class to represent a Data Stream

The DataStream facilitates the block interface. From the interface standpoint, the two functions which are useful are: - get_block(block_size) -> returns a DataBlock of the given block_size from the stream - write_block(block) -> writes the block of data to the stream

The DataStream can act as a stream object for both writing and reading blocks The two more useful sub-classes of the abstract class are FileDataStream and ListDataStream. (see their description for more details)

get_block(block_size: int) → core.data_block.DataBlock

returns a block of data (of the given max size) from the stream

Parameters

block_size (int) – the size of the block of data to be returned.

Return type

DataBlock

abstract get_symbol()

returns a symbol from the data stream, returns None if the stream is finished

This is an abstract method, and hence needs to be implemented by the subclasses

abstract reset()

resets the data stream

write_block(data_block: core.data_block.DataBlock)

write the input block to the stream

Parameters

data_block (DataBlock) – block to be written to the stream

abstract write_symbol(s)

writes the given symbol to the stream

The symbol can be appropriately converted to a particular format before writing. This is an abstract method and so, the subclass will have to implement it

Parameters

s (Any) – symbol to be written to the stream

class data_stream.FileDataStream(file_path: str, permissions='r')

Bases: data_stream.DataStream

Abstract class to create a data stream from a File

The FileDataStream defines __exit__, __enter__ methods on top of DataStream. These methods handle file obj opening/closing

Subclasses (eg: TextDataStream) need to imeplement methods get_symbol, write_symbol to get a functional object.

reset()

resets the file object to the beginning

class data_stream.ListDataStream(input_list: List)

Bases: data_stream.DataStream

ListDataStream is a wrapper around a list of symbols. It is useful to: - extract data from the list block by block - write data to the list block by block

In practice, this class might be used mainly for testing (as usually you would read data from a file.. see FileDataStream for that)

get_symbol() → Any

returns the next symbol from the self.input_list

reset()

resets the current_ind counter

write_symbol(s: Any)

adds a symbol to the stream

class data_stream.TextFileDataStream(file_path: str, permissions='r')

Bases: data_stream.FileDataStream

FileDataStream to read/write text data

get_symbol()

get the next character from the text file

as we read character data from file by default, the get_symbol function does not need to do anything special conversions

Returns

the next character, None if we reached the end of stream

Return type

(str, None)

write_symbol(s)

write a character to the text file
